results.title: Ananse's farm
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig and John Ossei
results.brief_description: A fable from Ghana, animated on film by a young African film-maker studying with the National Film Board. Ananse is a spider with a heart full of concern over the enmity existing between his friends. Instead of mediating in a straightforward way, he devises a scheme using a little deception to bring his friends to amicable terms. The moral of this folktale from Ghana is that employing the wrong means to an end brings undesired consequences, no matter how right the motive.

results.title: Analytical filtration
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional films produced to assist science teachers to demonstrate laboratory techniques to large groups of students. The film covers, in complete detail, the various operations involved in the simple technique of analytical filtration.

results.title: Analysis of Agility Exercises
results.brief_description: Film based on the Board of Education Syllabus of Physical Training for Schools (1933). Children in the film were drawn from city and borough elementary school. Various physical training exercises are demonstrated including crouch jumps, cat springs, broad jumps, hop, step, and jump forward, backward rolls and cartwheels.

results.title: Analysis of a television commercial
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Eric Halliday and Vass Contis
results.brief_description: Eric Halliday interviews Bruce Kerridge, producer of the Mining Industry Council commercials and Dr. Ian Mills, a La Trobe University lecturer who indicate reasons for the production of a commercial and a method for interpreting the same.

results.title: Analysis by mass: an introduction to the mass spectrometer
results.creator_credit: Associated Electrical Industries Film Unit, Michael Clarke and Brian Kaufman
results.brief_description: Structure of atom and nucleus; definition of isotopes; principle of the mass spectograph, explained by a model in which balls of different masses are deflected by different amounts in a constant magnetic field. Construction of a mass spectrometer. Uses of mass spectrometry: to identify molecules, determine molecular structure, measure impurities, analyse gases in breath, radioactive dating of rocks.

results.title: An Untitled film
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed black and white film in slow motion of life on a farm - dogs, cats, chickens, horses, a man shovelling and burning grass, and a boy watching a chicken being strangled. These strong images are accompanied by experimental music that compliments this well shot film.

results.title: An Unremarkable birth
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Kathleen Shannon and Diane Beaudry
results.brief_description: A growing number of parents are concerned about the impersonal approach to childbirth seen in many hospitals. They find hospital procedures inflexible and more often geared to the needs of the institution than to those of child and parent. Members of the medical profession and parents discuss today’s obstetric methods and alternatives to them. The film candidly records the birth of a baby and the interaction of mother and father.

results.title: An unnecessary famine
results.creator_credit: Yorkshire Television, Chris Bryer, Peter Gordon and Ian McFarlane
results.brief_description: Using Sudan as an example, shows that the causes of hunger in developing nations are both natural and political. Considers the roles of the World Bank and the major economic powers in this situation

results.title: An Oriental city: Canton China
results.creator_credit: Louis de Rochemont Associates, Louis De Rochemont and Victor Jurgens
results.brief_description: In ancient oriental cities where there is contact with other countries through trade, there is an incongruous mixture of modern ways with the old. Canton is an old city steeped in the traditions of many generations. Its location of the Si River makes it an important centre of commerce and industry.

results.title: An Ordinary woman
results.brief_description: Jackie is 38 years old. She lives with John and they have two small children. Once she wanted to be an opera singer. Once she had a boyfriend called Paul who married someone else. Once she travelled overseas. In the Sixties she was in love with Charlie. In the Seventies she sang in a band. In the Eighties she makes scones with the kids. In the process of (re) presenting an ordinary woman’s life this film explores questions of identity, representation and truth.
